metadata.dc:author: Bollo de Miguel, Elena
Juárez Morales, Carmen
Muñiz González, Francisco
Romero de Tejada, José Andrés García
metadata.dc:description: Idiopathic interstitial pneumonias (IIPs) are a diagnostic challenge for pneumologists, radiologists and pathologists alike. The classification of IPPs is currently controversial. Pulmonary function testing is an essential component in order to establish a diagnosis and is required to guide prognosis and follow-up and monitor treatment outcome. High-resolution computed tomography is also essential for the diagnosis of IPPs and may also provide data on disease activity and prognosis.
metadata.dc:title: Neumonías intersticiales idiopáticas.
[idiopathic interstitial pneumonia].
